events.message: The customer reported a vehicle collision that occurred on April 30th, requesting to file an official claim for the damages sustained.
The claim was categorised under 'Auto Accident' based on the customerâ€™s description mentioning car collision and vehicle damage.
An insurance agent was assigned to the case to assist the customer throughout the claims process and coordinate necessary inspections.
The customer received an acknowledgment notification confirming that the auto accident claim has been officially accepted and logged.
The agent requested photos of the damaged vehicle, the accident report, and driver's license copies to proceed with the investigation.
The customer submitted all requested documents including police report, photo evidence of the collision, and personal identification.
The insurance company began investigating the claim by reviewing submitted evidence and contacting involved parties for verification.
Investigation concluded confirming the liability and extent of damages caused by the auto accident as reported by the customer.
A settlement offer was proposed outlining coverage details and the estimated amount to be paid for vehicle repairs.
The customer expressed satisfaction with the proposed settlement and appreciated the prompt communication throughout the claim process.
The insurance claim was formally approved following acceptance of the settlement terms by the customer.
The payment to cover vehicle repair costs was successfully issued and transferred to the customer's designated bank account.
The claim case was officially closed after confirming receipt of payment and customer satisfaction with the resolution.
All claim documents and correspondence were archived for record-keeping and future reference in accordance with company policies.
